title: Spoofed SSID Cleanup
description:
Oh no! Alice, Mira's best friend, just got hit with sneaky spyware after connecting to what she thought was the café's safe Wi-Fi. But wait—there are TWO networks with the same name! One's a wolf in sheep's clothing, and it's up to you to sniff it out and take it down before more friends get caught in the trap.

Objective: Become a Wi-Fi detective! Use airodump-ng to spot the fake AP and aireplay-ng to kick it off the network like a bouncer at a club.
dialogue: Mira: "Hey, detective! Alice just got bombarded with creepy pop-ups after grabbing coffee. She swore she connected to 'CoffeeShopWifi', but I spotted something fishy—two networks with the exact same name!"
Mira: "One's legit, the other's a sneaky imposter trying to steal data. Can you help me hunt it down and shut it down? Alice is freaking out, and we can't let this digital bandit win!"
Mira: "Let's turn the tables and show this rogue AP who's boss!"
hints: Look for two APs with identical SSIDs but different MAC addresses—like twins with different fingerprints!
Fire up airodump-ng to scan the airwaves, then use aireplay-ng to deauth the bad guy and send it packing.
Pro tip: Monitor mode is your secret weapon—switch your Wi-Fi card to spy mode!
